course.subject: ECON
course.name: Time Series Econometrics and Business Forecasting
course.description: The use of time series data for business forecasting is examined using the methods of regression analysis, exponential and Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) techniques.
course.prerequisites: ECON 3334 OR MATH 4424
course.exclusions: ISOM 4540, MATH 4425

reviews.author: majorintoxic
reviews.title: [勸世]遠離王鵬更稱心x_x
reviews.comment_content:
原本想用英文寫 但英文唔好 當淨係寫比local參考
TLDR:終極大伏course，有需要都唔好reg (4274 4284更稱心)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
聽講有唔少人聽到Time Series就狗衝reg左呢個course，我自己都唔例外。其實reg之前已經聽朋友講過呢個course係終極大伏，而事實上都真係幾伏下。(以下based on CourseReviewer師兄嘅review加多少少補充)

Syllabus嚟講其實唔太差，入面好多testing喺做ECON4670 paper其實都好有用(like ECON4474)，最常用嘅有Granger Causality, ADF Test (btw想識呢啲自己學就得，真係唔洗特登讀呢個course)。但係同CourseReviewer講嘅一樣，就係太theoretical，好多時你淨係知道個general picture，但係其實點樣apply落去做你堆research你係唔會知。咁至於點解你淨係會識general picture同definition呢，係因為王鵬會話:the proof involved a lot of maths, and beyond the scope of this course. 加上佢自己都好少教application

個title叫Business Forecasting，但其實成個course都唔知學左啲咩forecasting。我諗所謂嘅forecasting應該就係take個堆time series入面嘅conditional expectation，所以唔好比個title呃左。

點解話呢個course係伏course，係因為呢個course根本就唔係考緊你識唔識啲嘢，係考緊你諗唔諗到堆corner solution。Midterm考左八成T/F，但聽王鵬講其實大部份題目都唔過50%人答啱。例如佢會問你time series嘅PACF，個答案你以為會好obvious，但之後王鵬會話，你唔知個time series係咪stationary㗎所以係not necessarily ture=.= 但係個問題係佢midterm前淨係輕輕帶過AR(1) stationary嘅condition( absolute value <1 )，去到midterm後先講non-stationary time series，咁唔怪得知得20幾%人答啱=.= 重點係佢上堂淨係會cover堆嘢嘅general picture，咁點會expect我哋識曬所有corner solution呢=.=

Midterm之後去到multivariate，更加多人唔知做緊啲咩，基本上堂堂成個chatroom都係問緊佢問題。

***因為midterm之後入multivariate全部都係vector matrix form，所以MATH2121入面嘅嘢係一定要識(vector-matrix addition/multiplication同埋null space)。唔識嘅話係唔會聽得明後面啲嘢，特別係佢成日玩埋啲matrix impluse response。

Syllabus自己碌落下面睇返 年年都差唔多(咁廢)
reviews.comment_teaching:
王鵬教書真係好悶，悶到係連開2倍速都頂唔順。我自己淨係上左頭幾堂就已經冇上，成個course都係自己睇notes。

上堂就係讀下ppt，得閑就玩下gretl同埋自己會手寫啲examples搵下expecation,variance,covariance,impulse response咁。係可以完全唔洗上堂都可以自己睇notes。btw你上堂個陣學到嗰堆嘢你final係完全冇用。

但最睇唔透嘅係佢完左sem study break(12/5)緊嗰陣無啦啦整多左份成5,6題入面有好多sub question嘅Review Question比我地做(16/5交)。話咩To incentivize you to take more effort, I will use it as a graded assignment. Anyone who uploaded their own work before the deadline will earn full marks as long as they show reasonable effort. 問題係佢出呢份HW嗰陣咁啱同時出左HW2/3嘅分，之後個TA係會因為答錯答案而扣人分，咁姐係又要我地好認真咁做嗰份Review Question，唔洗溫其他科咩大佬.... 之後佢份solution仲要考之前幾日先post，重點係成份Review Question同final係一啲都唔似，成件事係極度反智。同埋佢midterm之前有個dry-run做完之後total score會加1%，咁如果你要incentivize，咁點解唔將份review question變做optional bonus呢?_?擺明就係自己出唔夠5份功課格硬變做一份graded assignment啦=.=

TA(Xu Feiting)成個sem都冇開過一次tutorial，淨係考完midterm之後開過一次解卷tutorial，印象中好似仲多人過平時lecture
留意返佢好似專做4000level econometrics TA(4284又係佢)，佢做TA嘅話自己睇路
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (15%) 原本就話會出5份 但最後淨係出左4份
Midterm (30%)
Final (55%)

Mean:
HW1: 2.87/3
HW2: 2.79/3
HW3: 2.77/3
HW4: 2.85/3
Midterm: 20.09/36
Final: Part 1: 18.39/25 Part 2:41.18/75 Total: 59.57/100

Homework一開波就話grade by effort，咁我assume做曬全部題目有手有腳都full啦，點知原來去到最後答錯係會扣你分。咁好心你一開始就唔好話grade by effort啦=.=

Midterm就content嗰邊講左係點，你當係玩IQ Test咁

Final份卷同Midterm比反而正常好多，但係佢今年無啦啦出左條題目係要用gretl generate嘅results去答個part a，如果答唔到個part a基本上成條(~24/100)都冇乜分執。佢之前好似講過話唔會考gretl，但最後都出左，都唔知係咪想玩班冇上堂嘅學生。
reviews.comment_workload:
除左4份功課要用少少時間擺上gretl做之外基本上真係冇乜workload。功課都會有gretl guideline教你點樣run，但留意返如果你interpret錯左堆gretl results都係會扣你分。

同其他4000level math course比其實係冇乜workload，content同ECON3334(小妹係lu xun教)一樣係少到根本唔需要花時間嚟溫書，所以真係唔明點解呢2個course會係4credit

reviews.author: CourseReviewer
reviews.title: Don't take this course unless you really need to (even then, think thrice)
reviews.comment_content:
Useful content, but way too theoretical. All we learned were the models and formulas - without actually using them.

Homeworks were slightly useful since we used Gretl, but let's be honest, who uses Gretl nowadays? Should've used Python/Matlab.

If this was a practical class where we actually got to analyze time series data, then sure, the content is good. But the content at this point is just pure theory with barely any application.

The professor tries to make the content relevant by adding some "research papers", but really, you only know the basic framework with 0 applicable skills to do your own time series analysis.

Syllabus below:
Economic question and data
Review of linear regression using time series data
Regression diagnostics, Structural break tests, Seasonality
AR, MA, ARMA
Vector Autoregression (VAR)
Cointegration
Vector Error Correction Model (VECM)
ARCH, GARCH
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is extremely monotonous and difficult to follow. You're better off not attending any classes, and instead watch lecture videos at 1.5x speed.

He deviates a lot from the powerpoints (i.e. comes up with his own questions and solves it). Guess what? Not even useful for the final exam.

You think his explanation is useful - because he actually explains the things on his powerpoint, but once you do the final exam,  you realize that you've just wasted >10 hours listening to his voice and writing notes for nothing....

Revision questions only come out 4-5 days before the exam (both for midterm and finals). Solutions come out 2 days before... no idea how he expects us to study. Guess what again? Revision questions are also barely relevant to the exam...

In his final class, he spends the whole class talking about "additional topics", with no discussion at all about the finals. When asked about the finals, he simply said "I haven't thought about the questions". F**king amazing....

TA (Feiting Xu) has also not conducted even one tutorial session during the whole semester.... She sent an email to everyone at the beginning of the class that she has a class during our tutorial time and propose to change it to another day. So since she has classes, we as students need to suffer? Not sure what we paid our school fee for....
reviews.comment_grading:
Syllabus mentioned:
Homework (15%): 5 graded problem sets at 3 points each.
Midterm (30%)
Final (55%)

However, this changed throughout the semester: There were suddenly only 4 graded problem sets at 3% each.

Midterm was out of 36%.
So perhaps finals is 52%?
Again, no idea. The professor nor the TA has ever communicated it to us.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is "very light" because there's literally nothing to do other than homeworks, which you can either find online or just follow his powerpoints.

Workload is so damn light that I'm not even sure what I learned in this course...

reviews.author: economist
reviews.title: Not recommended but can try if you are as brave as Sara Bareilles
reviews.comment_content:
I have put the focus in parenthesis.
Topic 1: Introduction (taking logs, in-sample/out-of-sample forecast)
Topic 2: Review of linear regression (t-stat, coefficient meaning of dummy variable)
Topic 3: Review of regression diagnostics (structural breaks)
Topic 4: Univariate time series models (stationary, white noises, calculation of conditional variance and expectation, derivation of ACF and PACF)
Mid-term exam
Topic 5: Multivariate time series models: VAR (impulse response, recall your memory of multivariable calculus or linear algebra, recursive VAR, the meaning of structural shocks in a different order)
Topic 6: Multivariate time series models: cointegration (cointegration identification, 2 unit root tests)
Topic 7: Volatility models: ARCH/GARCH (complex calculations for sure)
Topic 8: A guide for empirical study (not covered in the final exam)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Poor. The lesson content is not well-designed. The course is not as rigorous as time series course offered by MATH department. The rubbish syllabus also tricked you that R will be used. But eventually only the outdated gretl was used with the lack of hands-on experience (since tutorials are missing in action). I guess that's because the TA was attending other lessons at that time since she once sent an email asking whether we agreed on changing tutorial time, and of coz, no one agreed.
WP lesson is sleepy as usual. After being tortured by ECON 3334 (owing to unlevel playing field), I could tell you that some questions in exams will go to the least discussed part in lessons like stationary, null spaces (study linear algebra course offered by math department) and HW2 (impulse response using techniques learnt in multi-variable calculus). You will be again left behind if you do not receive enough math training.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (15%): DO NOT BELIEVE IT IS GRADED BY EFFORT. The cunning TA suddenly graded by correctness.

Midterm (30%): Many tricky questions go to test the concept of stationarity and structural break.
TOTAL 36: Mean: 20.09 High: 32 Low: 11.5

Final (55%): The style suddenly becomes normal. LQs on ARCH/GARCH, impulse response functions, and null space.
Part 1 (SQ) TOTAL 25:   Mean: 18.39 High: 25 Low: 3
Part 2 (LQ) TOTAL 75:    Mean: 41.18 High: 69 Low: 15
reviews.comment_workload:
Little.
Originally, there are 5 homework. But eventually there are only 3 assignments. Thus, he suddenly gave us the 4th "HW" during the exam period. However, it gave little clue on how the exam looks like. So not sure how the marks will add up to 15%. Otherwise, little workload at all.

reviews.author: asdfqwg349sfd
reviews.title: Just Don't Try Taking This Course
reviews.comment_content: I won't write the content since everyone else mentioned it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Monotone voice. He explained well about contents in the ppt, but those were not useful in the actual exam.

The TA only conducted a tutorial ONCE to go over the answers for the midterm exam. Terrible management by TA.

Also, at the beginning of the course, the HWs were supposed to be graded by effort, but apparently, the TA graded based on accuracy.

reviews.author: Testing1234
reviews.title: A good course that you can consider taking if you want to further study economics
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1. Introduction
Topic 2: Review of Linear Regression Using Time Series Data
Topic 3: Review of Regression Diagnostics: A Time Series Perspective
Topic 4. Univariate Time Series Models
Topic 5. Volatility Models
Topic 6. Multivariate Time Series Models: Vector Autoregression (VAR)
Topic 7: Non-stationary Time Series: Time Trend and Stochastic Trend
Topic 8. Multivariate Time Series: Modeling the Long-Run Relationship

I think it is kinda interesting, if you attend all lectures and spend some time after class to review the materials, you can catch up easily.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ng is friendly and can deliver the topics clearly. Sometimes he also uses R codes to support his teaching. If you have any questions you can also ask him after class, he will be happy to answer them.

Jeremy is also a very good TA. He is very helpful in assignments and exams. Remember don't skip any tutorials, codes in tutorials are very useful in exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (20%): Three or four assignments
Midterm (35%)
Final Exam (45%)
both midterm and final are open book, but you can only check the lecture slides and the R codes that are uploaded on Canvas.

Here are some details:
Homework 1: mean 93.33, median 95, me 100
Homework 2: mean 80.18, median 90, me 98
Homework 3: mean 79.91, median 93, me 100
Midterm: mean 74.35, median 72, UQ 88, max 96, me 93
Final: not released, but I'm sure I mess it up.

Overall: A
reviews.comment_workload: Reasonable. There are 3 assignments and you really have to spend some time on it. Some questions are difficult and I spent around 5-6 hours on each homework. There are 2 parts for the assignment, midterm and final. The first part is theoretical, which you've to answer by writing the solution. The second part is analysis, which you have to type R code and get the results. No worry you don't have to type everything from zero. Basically you only have to copy paste the correct code from the examples.

reviews.author: Peter Lau
reviews.title: Good content and very useful
reviews.comment_content:
The content was very useful if you would like to do time series analysis.

1. Economic question and data
2. Review of linear regression using time series data
3. Regression diagnostics, Structural break tests, Seasonality
4. AR, MA, ARMA
5. Vector Autoregression (VAR)
6. Cointegration
7. Non-stationarity
8. Vector Error Correction Model (VECM)
9. ARCH, GARCH
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor would illustrate the econometric concepts with a lot of real empirical economic research papers done by the other researchers. This was very helpful for us to understand how could we apply the econometric models to real time series data. Overall, the professor's teaching was good but sometimes you would not be able to understand the equations just because they were really difficult. You would need to spend some time to read the textbook if you really want to fully understand the content.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was fair but be aware that most of the students enrolled in this class were QFIN, MAEC and ECOF.

My Scores:
HW1 (~8.33%): 10/10 (mean: 8.9)
HW2 (~8.33%): 10/10 (mean: 9.3)
HW3 (~8.33%): 10/10 (mean 9.3)
Midterm (25%): 98/100 (mean: 72.6, high: 98)
Final (50%): 85/100 (mean: 71.8, high: 97)

Final Grade: A

For the homework, just follow the lecture notes and you would be able to finish them. We used gretl to run the time series model. It would be more practical if the professor could teach us how to use R to run those models.

For the exams, most of the questions were about the derivations of the time series models (AR, MA, ARMA, VAR, VECM and GARCH). To get high marks, make sure that you know how to derive the unconditional/conditional mean and variance, n-step ahead forecast and forecasting errors of the models. Some questions in the midterm were about monte carlo simulation.
reviews.comment_workload: The explicit workload was low because the homeworks were very easy to do. However, if you want to get a good grade, you will need to spend a lot of time to read the textbook and understand how to derive the formulas.
